intro: Gaytania daucoides, commonly known as the Mexican parsley or wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as streambanks and forests. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
